bibl.title: Different Parallels, Different Interpretations. Reading Parallels between Ancient Egyptian and Greek Works of Literature.
Greco-Egyptian Interactions. Literature, Translation, and Culture, 500 BCE - 300 CE.

bibl.note: Introduction. - The Examples: 1. The Battle of Qadesh and The Iliad; - 2. Love Poems and Sappho's poetry; - 3. The Myth of the Sun's Eye and Aesopic fables; - 4. The Stories of Setne Khamwas and The Odyssey; - 5. Wisdom Literature. - Conclusions.
bibl.seg: Nikolaos Lazaridis, Different Parallels, Different Interpretations. Reading Parallels between Ancient Egyptian and Greek Works of Literature.
Ian Rutherford (ed.), Greco-Egyptian Interactions. Literature, Translation, and Culture, 500 BCE - 300 CE (Oxford, 2016) pp. 187-207, 1 fig.

Introduction. - The Examples: 1. The Battle of Qadesh and The Iliad; - 2. Love Poems and Sappho's poetry; - 3. The Myth of the Sun's Eye and Aesopic fables; - 4. The Stories of Setne Khamwas and The Odyssey; - 5. Wisdom Literature. - Conclusions.
